finimom 0.0.0.9000

    Beta-binomial prior for model dimension Non-local priors Minimal example

    finimom: fine-mapping using inverse-moment prior

    Finimom package implements a method for fine-mapping summarised genetic data using product inverse-moment prior the effect sizes, and a beta-binomial prior for the model dimension.

    Installation

    You can install finimom from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("vkarhune/finimom")

    Minimal example

    Here is a minimal example on using finimom:

    
# load package
library(finimom)

beta <- exampledata$betahat
se <- exampledata$sebetahat
eaf <- exampledata$allelefreq
R <- exampledata$insampleLD

res <- finimom(beta = beta, se = se, eaf = eaf, R = R, u = 1.5, insampleLD = TRUE)
#> Clumping variants at r2=0.98
#> Sampling from the posterior...

#> 
#> 12500 iterations done in 33.36 seconds

res$sets
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] 167 169 172 174 177 179 180 183 186 187 188 190 193 194 208 209
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 168 175 178 181 189 195 196 200 201 202 204 205 210 211 212 213 214 215 216
#> [20] 218 219 220 221 223 224 227 230 232 234 235 238 239 240 241 242 248 251 254

# compare with the true causal variants
exampledata$causals
#> [1]  14 179 195

# check whether the true causals were captured by the credible sets

sapply(res$sets, function(x) exampledata$causals %in% x)
#>       [,1]  [,2]
#> [1,] FALSE FALSE
#> [2,]  TRUE FALSE
#> [3,] FALSE  TRUE
